program_info.name: IFBB Classic Physique Builder
program_info.subtitle: Competition-Ready Aesthetic Development Program
program_info.description: A comprehensive 16-week program designed to build the classic aesthetic physique required for IFBB Classic Physique competition. Emphasizes V-taper, symmetry, proportion, and conditioning. Based on training principles used by champions like Chris Bumstead, Breon Ansley, and Terrence Ruffin.

men.focus: V-taper, shoulder-to-waist ratio, overall symmetry, classic proportions
men.height_weight_class: Height-specific weight limits apply (e.g., 5'10" max 212 lbs)
men.conditioning: Lean but not shredded like open bodybuilding
men.poses: Classic poses emphasizing flow and aesthetics

women.focus: Balanced physique, feminine lines, athletic development, conditioning
women.conditioning: Lean with muscle definition, not overly dry
women.poses: Quarter turns, emphasis on shape and proportion

key_principles: Prioritize shoulder and back width for V-taper
Maintain small waist through core control and diet
Build proportionate legs without overwhelming upper body
Emphasize muscle shape and detail over pure size
Structured periodization: mass phase → strength phase → conditioning phase

program_structure.training_split: 5-Day Body Part Split with optional 6th day

training_days.day_7: Rest or Legs (Hamstrings/Glutes focus) for advanced

cardio_protocol.off_season_weeks_1_8: 3x per week, 20-30 min LISS (Low Intensity Steady State)
cardio_protocol.pre_contest_weeks_9_12: 4x per week, 30-40 min LISS + 2x HIIT sessions
cardio_protocol.contest_prep_weeks_13_16: 5-6x per week, 40-50 min LISS + 2-3x HIIT sessions

posing_practice.focus: Classic poses: Front/Back Double Bicep, Side Chest, Front/Back Lat Spread, Abdominal & Thigh, Most Muscular (optional)
posing_practice.importance: Critical for stage presence and muscle control

training_phases.description: Focus on adding quality muscle mass while maintaining proportion. Higher calories, moderate-to-high volume, progressive overload.

workouts.focus: Full chest development with emphasis on upper chest

exercises.instructions: 30-45 degree incline. Lower to upper chest. This is your strength builder.
exercises.form_cues: Retract scapula, arch lower back slightly, drive through floor with feet
exercises.progression: Add weight when you hit 10 clean reps on all sets

exercises.instructions: Deep stretch at bottom, squeeze at top. Dumbbells allow greater ROM than barbell.
exercises.form_cues: Lower until you feel deep stretch in chest, don't let dumbbells touch
exercises.progression: Add weight or reps each week

exercises.instructions: Slight bend in elbows throughout. Focus on stretch and squeeze.
exercises.form_cues: Think of hugging a tree. Pause and squeeze at top.

exercises.instructions: Cables at upper position, cross over at waist level. Targets lower chest.
exercises.form_cues: Lean slightly forward, cross hands over each other at bottom
exercises.progression: Add weight in small increments (5-10 lbs)

exercises.instructions: Lean forward 30 degrees, go deep. Add weight with belt when bodyweight is easy.
exercises.form_cues: Keep elbows flared slightly, chest out
exercises.progression: Add weight via dip belt when bodyweight × 15 is achieved

exercises.instructions: Full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top. Pause 2 seconds at top.
exercises.form_cues: Control the negative, explode up, squeeze hard at top
exercises.progression: Add weight when you hit 20 reps with squeeze

exercises.instructions: Higher reps for soleus development. Soleus works when knee is bent.
exercises.form_cues: Full ROM, squeeze at top
exercises.progression: Progressive overload with weight and reps

workouts.notes: Upper chest priority for classic physique aesthetic. Calves respond to high volume.

workouts.focus: Width and thickness for V-taper. Critical for Classic Physique.

exercises.instructions: Primary mass and strength builder. Use straps if needed to focus on back vs. grip.
exercises.form_cues: Neutral spine, drive through heels, squeeze glutes at top
exercises.progression: Primary strength exercise. Add weight conservatively.

exercises.instructions: Wider grip emphasizes lat width. Pull to upper chest, squeeze lats.
exercises.form_cues: Lead with elbows, think 'elbows to pockets', arch upper back
exercises.progression: Add weight with belt for pull-ups, or increase weight on pulldown

exercises.instructions: Bent over 45 degrees, row to lower chest. Build thickness.
exercises.form_cues: Pull with elbows, not arms. Squeeze shoulder blades together.

exercises.instructions: Support on bench. Row to hip, full stretch at bottom.
exercises.form_cues: Don't rotate torso. Pull elbow straight back.
exercises.progression: Increase weight when form is perfect at 12 reps

exercises.instructions: Pull to lower abdomen. Stretch forward, squeeze back.
exercises.form_cues: Keep chest up, don't round back on stretch

exercises.instructions: Arms nearly straight throughout. Feel lats stretch and contract.
exercises.form_cues: Slight forward lean, pull to thighs, squeeze lats
exercises.progression: Focus on mind-muscle connection, then add weight

exercises.instructions: Pull to face level, external rotation at peak. Critical for shoulder health.
exercises.form_cues: Pull apart at face level, rotate hands back
exercises.progression: Higher reps for rear delt development

exercises.instructions: Raise legs to 90 degrees minimum. Add ankle weights when bodyweight is easy.
exercises.form_cues: Control the swing, don't use momentum
exercises.progression: Add reps, then ankle weights, then weight between feet

exercises.instructions: Kneel, crunch down, squeeze abs hard. Don't pull with arms.
exercises.form_cues: Round spine, pull with abs not arms

workouts.notes: Width exercises (pull-ups, pulldowns) are critical for V-taper. High volume for back in classic physique.

workouts.focus: 3D delt development - CRITICAL for classic physique. Wide shoulders create V-taper.

exercises.instructions: Primary shoulder mass builder. Press from clavicle to overhead.
exercises.form_cues: Core tight, don't overarch back, full lockout overhead

exercises.instructions: THE most important exercise for shoulder width. Strict form essential.
exercises.form_cues: Lead with elbows, slight forward lean, raise to shoulder height
exercises.progression: Perfect form over heavy weight. Add weight in 2.5-5 lb increments.

exercises.instructions: Seated for stricter form. Press from shoulder level to overhead.
exercises.form_cues: Back against bench, press straight up, don't let dumbbells touch

exercises.instructions: Cable provides constant tension. Cross cable behind body.
exercises.form_cues: Raise across body, keep tension throughout ROM

exercises.exercise_name: Reverse Pec Deck or Rear Delt Flyes
exercises.instructions: Critical for 3D shoulders and posing. Often undertrained.
exercises.form_cues: Lead with elbows, squeeze shoulder blades together
exercises.progression: Focus on contraction quality, then add weight

exercises.instructions: Raise to eye level. Front delts get work from pressing, so less volume needed.
exercises.form_cues: Don't swing, controlled raise, squeeze at top

exercises.instructions: Straight up and down. Don't roll shoulders. Squeeze hard at top.
exercises.form_cues: Think 'ears to shoulders', hold squeeze 2 seconds

exercises.instructions: From knees or standing (advanced). Maintain neutral spine.
exercises.form_cues: Don't let hips sag, pull back with abs
exercises.progression: Add reps, then progress to standing variation

exercises.instructions: Hold perfect position. Add weight plate on back when needed.
exercises.form_cues: Straight line from head to heels, squeeze glutes and abs

workouts.notes: Shoulder width is THE defining feature of classic physique. High volume for medial delts.

workouts.focus: Balanced leg development without overwhelming upper body proportions

exercises.instructions: King of leg exercises. Deep squat, drive through heels.
exercises.form_cues: Chest up, knees track over toes, sit back and down

exercises.instructions: More quad-focused than back squat. Front squat = more upright, Hack = machine.
exercises.form_cues: Keep torso upright, full depth

exercises.instructions: Deep ROM. Control the negative. Heavy weight possible safely.
exercises.form_cues: Don't let lower back round at bottom, full extension at top
exercises.progression: Add plates progressively, focus on deep ROM

exercises.exercise_name: Walking Lunges or Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.instructions: Unilateral work for balance and symmetry. Hold dumbbells.
exercises.form_cues: Keep front knee behind toes, upright torso

exercises.instructions: Isolation for quad sweep. Squeeze hard at top.
exercises.form_cues: Point toes up, squeeze at peak contraction
exercises.progression: Add weight, focus on quality contraction

exercises.instructions: Feel stretch in hamstrings. Don't round back.
exercises.form_cues: Push hips back, slight knee bend, feel hamstring stretch

exercises.instructions: Curl heels to glutes. Squeeze at top.
exercises.form_cues: Don't let hips rise, squeeze hamstrings

exercises.instructions: Full ROM. Pause at top.
exercises.form_cues: Deep stretch, explosive raise, 2-second squeeze
exercises.progression: Add weight when you hit 20 reps

workouts.notes: Legs should be developed but not overpower upper body in classic physique. Balance is key.

workouts.focus: Proportionate arm development - biceps peak, triceps sweep, forearms

exercises.instructions: Primary triceps mass builder. Hands shoulder-width apart.
exercises.form_cues: Elbows close to body, lower to lower chest

exercises.instructions: Primary biceps mass builder. Strict form, no swinging.
exercises.form_cues: Elbows stationary, full ROM, squeeze at top

exercises.instructions: Stretches long head of triceps. Keep elbows pointing up.
exercises.form_cues: Elbows stay pointed toward ceiling, deep stretch
exercises.progression: Add weight when form is perfect

exercises.instructions: 45-degree incline. Emphasizes biceps peak and long head stretch.
exercises.form_cues: Let arms hang, full stretch, curl without moving upper arm

exercises.instructions: Full extension, squeeze at bottom. Rope allows pronation for extra contraction.
exercises.form_cues: Elbows pinned, extend fully, squeeze

exercises.instructions: Neutral grip (palms facing each other). Builds arm thickness.
exercises.form_cues: Keep palms facing each other throughout, no rotation

exercises.instructions: Stay upright for triceps focus (vs. leaning forward for chest).
exercises.form_cues: Body vertical, elbows back, full extension
exercises.progression: Add weight with belt when bodyweight is easy

exercises.instructions: Seated, elbow braced on inner thigh. Peak contraction exercise.
exercises.form_cues: Squeeze hard at top, slow negative
exercises.progression: Focus on peak contraction, then add weight

exercises.instructions: Forearms on bench or thighs, palms up. Full ROM.
exercises.form_cues: Let weight roll to fingers, curl back up

exercises.instructions: Palms down variation. Balances forearm development.
exercises.form_cues: Control the weight, full ROM

exercises.instructions: Higher volume for soleus. Knee bent targets soleus.
exercises.form_cues: Full ROM, squeeze at top

workouts.notes: Arms should be proportionate, not overpowering. Focus on shape and detail.

workouts.focus: Optional second leg day focusing on hamstrings and glutes. For advanced athletes or those needing more posterior development.

exercises.instructions: Primary hamstring mass builder. Feel the stretch.
exercises.form_cues: Hips back, slight knee bend, chest up

exercises.instructions: Isolation for hamstring development.
exercises.form_cues: Squeeze at top, control negative

exercises.instructions: Barbell across hips. Squeeze glutes hard at top.
exercises.form_cues: Drive through heels, squeeze glutes, hold at top

exercises.instructions: Hold dumbbells. Long strides emphasize glutes/hamstrings.
exercises.form_cues: Long stride, upright torso, push through heel

exercises.instructions: Different angle than lying variation. Hits hamstrings differently.
exercises.form_cues: Squeeze at contraction, slow negative

exercises.instructions: Posterior chain finisher. Hold weight plate or barbell.
exercises.form_cues: Hinge at hips, maintain neutral spine

workouts.notes: Optional for advanced athletes or those needing extra hamstring/glute work. Can replace rest day.

training_phases.description: Lower rep ranges with heavier weight. Build strength while maintaining muscle mass. Begin increasing conditioning work.
training_phases.sets_per_exercise: 4-5 working sets for compounds, 3-4 for isolation
training_phases.modifications: Same exercise selection as Phase 1, but adjust rep ranges and intensity as specified. Add 1-2 extra sets to main compound movements.
training_phases.cardio_increase: Add 4th day of LISS, introduce 2x per week HIIT (15-20 min)
training_phases.nutrition: Begin slight calorie reduction if needed for conditioning

training_phases.description: Final conditioning for competition. Higher reps, shorter rest, increased cardio. Maintain muscle while dropping body fat.
training_techniques: Drop sets on final set of isolation exercises
Partial reps at end of sets for pump
training_phases.cardio_peak: 5-6 days per week LISS (40-50 min) + 2-3 days HIIT (20 min)
training_phases.nutrition: Caloric deficit, high protein, strategic refeeds

nutrition_plan.overview: Nutrition periodization matches training phases. Off-season surplus for growth, pre-contest deficit for conditioning.

phases.goal: Muscle growth in caloric surplus while minimizing fat gain

calories.adjustment: Track weight weekly. Aim for 0.5-1 lb gain per week. Adjust calories if needed.

protein.sources: Chicken breast, turkey, lean beef, fish (salmon, tilapia), eggs, egg whites, Greek yogurt, whey protein, casein protein

carbohydrates.sources: White rice, brown rice, jasmine rice, sweet potato, regular potato, oatmeal, cream of rice, pasta, quinoa, fruits (bananas, berries)
carbohydrates.timing: Concentrated around training (before/after), moderate at other meals

fats.sources: Avocado, olive oil, coconut oil, nuts (almonds, cashews), nut butter, fatty fish (salmon), whole eggs, MCT oil
fats.timing: Distributed throughout day, lower around workout

phases.meal_frequency: 5-6 meals per day, eating every 2.5-3 hours

meal_1_breakfast.foods: 6 whole eggs, 1 cup oatmeal, 1 banana, 1 tbsp almond butter

meal_2_mid_morning.foods: 8 oz chicken breast, 1.5 cups white rice, 1 cup broccoli, 1 tsp olive oil

meal_3_pre_workout.foods: 8 oz ground turkey (93% lean), 2 medium sweet potatoes, green beans

intra_workout.foods: Optional: 20g EAAs or BCAAs, 50g carbs from Gatorade/dextrose (if training >90 min)

meal_4_post_workout.foods: 2 scoops whey protein, 100g cream of rice, 1 banana, honey

meal_5_dinner.foods: 10 oz salmon, 2 cups jasmine rice, asparagus, 1/2 avocado

meal_6_before_bed.foods: 2 scoops casein protein, 2 tbsp natural peanut butter, small apple

phases.goal: Maintain muscle mass, build strength, begin conditioning

calories.adjustment: Maintenance to slight surplus. Aim for steady weight.

protein.note: Protein stays high or increases as calories drop

carbohydrates.note: Moderate reduction to accommodate increased cardio

phases.adjustments: Reduce portions slightly from Phase 1. Keep protein high. Time carbs around workouts.

phases.goal: Maximum conditioning and muscle definition while preserving mass

calories.adjustment: Aim for 1-2 lbs loss per week. Weekly adjustments based on progress.
calories.final_week: Consult with coach for peak week protocols

protein.note: Highest protein phase to preserve muscle in deficit

carbohydrates.note: Lower overall, but implement strategic refeeds
carbohydrates.carb_cycling: Low days: 0.8g/lb, High days: 1.5g/lb, rotate based on training

fats.note: Lowest fat phase, never below 0.25g/lb for hormones

phases.meal_frequency: 6-7 smaller meals to manage hunger and maintain metabolism

refeed_strategy.implementation: Increase carbs to 2.5-3g/lb for 1 day, reduce fats slightly, keep protein same
refeed_strategy.purpose: Replenish glycogen, boost leptin, psychological break

meal_1.foods: 10 egg whites, 1 whole egg, 1 cup oatmeal, berries

meal_2.foods: 6 oz chicken breast, 1 cup white rice, green beans

meal_3_pre_workout.foods: 6 oz ground turkey (93%), 1 medium sweet potato, spinach

meal_4_post_workout.foods: 2 scoops whey protein, 80g cream of rice, blueberries

meal_5.foods: 8 oz tilapia, 1 cup jasmine rice, asparagus

meal_6.foods: 6 oz chicken breast, large salad, 2 tsp olive oil, veggies

meal_7_before_bed.foods: 2 scoops casein protein, 1 tbsp peanut butter

peak_week_overview.description: Final 7 days before competition. Highly individual. MUST work with experienced coach.
common_strategies: Water loading days 7-3 (2+ gallons), then taper days 2-1
Carb depletion days 6-4, carb load days 3-1
Timing of final meals and water before stage
Practice posing daily with pump-up routine
peak_week_overview.warning: Peak week can make or break a physique. Never experiment for the first time on show week.

supplements_contest_prep: Caffeine: Strategic use for energy and thermogenesis
Yohimbine: Optional for stubborn fat (use carefully)
Glycerol: Peak week for muscle fullness (under coach guidance)

general_nutrition_principles.food_quality: 80% whole foods, 20% flexible. Prioritize micronutrient-dense choices.
general_nutrition_principles.meal_timing: Pre-workout meal 1.5-2 hours before training. Post-workout nutrition within 30-60 minutes.
general_nutrition_principles.hydration: Minimum 1 gallon daily, more during contest prep. Monitor urine color.
general_nutrition_principles.fiber: 25-35g daily from vegetables, fruits, whole grains. Critical for digestion and satiety.
general_nutrition_principles.sodium: Don't restrict unnecessarily until final peak week (if at all). Needed for muscle pumps and performance.
general_nutrition_principles.alcohol: Minimize or eliminate, especially weeks 9-16. Empty calories, impairs recovery.
general_nutrition_principles.cheat_meals: Phase 1: 1-2 per week. Phase 2: 1 per week. Phase 3: Strategic refeeds only, no 'cheat meals'.
general_nutrition_principles.tracking: Use app like MyFitnessPal. Weigh food for accuracy. Weekly progress photos and measurements.

contest_day_nutrition.morning_of_show: Small easily digestible meals every 2-3 hours. Example: Rice cakes with nut butter, Gatorade, simple carbs.
contest_day_nutrition.backstage: Sip water as needed (don't chug). Rice cakes, candy (pixie sticks, gummy bears) for quick pump.
contest_day_nutrition.pump_up_foods: Fast-digesting carbs 20-30 min before stage. Avoid fats.
contest_day_nutrition.timing: Last substantial meal 3-4 hours before prejudging.
contest_day_nutrition.practice: Rehearse entire day during peak week practice run.

posing_routine.importance: Posing can make or break your placement. Practice is NON-NEGOTIABLE.
mandatory_poses_men: Most Muscular (optional in classic physique, but often done)
practice_tips: Hold each pose for 30-60 seconds (builds endurance)
Practice without pump (to see real conditioning)
Work on facial expressions and stage presence
posing_routine.posing_as_workout: Holding poses is isometric training. Burns calories, improves muscle control and conditioning.

tanning_and_presentation.tanning: Mandatory for stage. Options: Professional spray tan (recommended), self-tanning products. Apply 24-48 hours before show.
tanning_and_presentation.suits: Men: Board shorts or posing trunks (depends on federation). Women: Figure suit (two-piece). Must fit perfectly.
tanning_and_presentation.grooming: Men: Chest, back, legs fully waxed/shaved. Clean haircut. Women: Hair, makeup professionally done.
tanning_and_presentation.practice_in_suit: Wear suit during posing practice final 2-3 weeks to ensure comfort and fit.

sleep.importance: Critical for muscle growth, recovery, hormone production
sleep.contest_prep: Even more important during deficit. May need 8-9 hours.

stress_management.cortisol: High stress = high cortisol = muscle loss + fat retention
stress_management.strategies: Meditation, breathing exercises, adequate sleep, time management
stress_management.contest_prep: Mental stress is high. Have support system.

injury_prevention.warm_up: 10-15 minutes dynamic warm-up + exercise-specific warm-up sets
injury_prevention.mobility: Daily stretching, foam rolling, mobility work
injury_prevention.listen_to_body: Back off if joints hurt. Ego lifting leads to injury.
injury_prevention.deload: Week 8 and Week 12 consider deload week (50-60% normal volume)

recovery_and_lifestyle.social_life: Will be restricted during contest prep. Plan accordingly. Support from family/friends critical.

4_weeks_out: Peak week protocol planned with coach
Practice run-through of entire show day
show_day: Pump up routine 20 min before stage

realistic_expectations.first_show: Goal is to gain experience, learn, and establish baseline. Winning is bonus.
realistic_expectations.physique_development: Takes years to develop classic physique. 16 weeks prepares what you've built.
realistic_expectations.placings: Judging is subjective. Focus on being your best, not comparing to others.
realistic_expectations.post_show: Plan for post-show nutrition. Reverse diet to maintenance, don't binge.
realistic_expectations.long_term: Most champions compete multiple times before winning. Learn from each show.

final_notes.coaching: Hiring experienced prep coach highly recommended, especially for first show.
final_notes.blood_work: Get blood work done before prep and mid-prep to monitor health markers.
final_notes.mental_health: Contest prep is mentally challenging. Have support system. Don't sacrifice mental health.
final_notes.sustainable: Classic Physique is aesthetic but still extreme. Can't stay stage-lean year-round.
final_notes.enjoy_process: This is your journey. Document it. Enjoy the transformation.
final_notes.federation_rules: Study your federation's rules (NPC, IFBB, etc.). Posing, attire, weight limits vary.
